request_pathways.name: Fax to YNHHS Release of Information Services
Mail to PO Box 9565, New Haven, CT 06535

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (dual-purpose: patient access and third-party release)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a system-wide fillable PDF authorization form that serves both patient self-access and third-party release, then submit by email, fax, or mail.

red_flags: Form last revised July 2019 — nearly seven years old and may not reflect current policies or facility configurations
bright_spots: MyChart portal delivery option listed as first delivery method
97 fillable interactive PDF fields — exceptionally high digital-first design
Three separate email addresses for different YNHHS entities (Hospital, NEMG, Yale Medicine)
Granular record type selection with 17 specific categories plus complete record option
Explicit 10-business-day turnaround commitment with customer service phone number

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — a basic web search immediately found the form, which is directly linked from the YNHHS 'Request Medical Records' page with no login or access barriers.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the form has 97 fillable fields enabling full digital completion, but requires printing for a wet signature before submitting electronically via email or fax.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — logical section flow, clear headers, and granular record selection, but dense legal prose in the 'I understand' statements and confusing double-negative framing for sensitive information opt-outs.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — despite 'Personal use' purpose checkbox and 'Access' in the title, patients must navigate a third-party release framework and designate themselves as the 'recipient,' with no HIPAA Right of Access citation.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization, no in-person requirement, clear revocation and voluntariness language, but fee disclosure is ambiguous and does not distinguish patient-access fees from third-party copy charges.

overall.summary: Yale New Haven Hospital provides a digitally mature, easy-to-find records request experience with an exceptionally fillable PDF and multiple submission options, but falls short of true patient-centeredness by routing all requests through a generic dual-purpose authorization form.
